message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of blind detection of polar codes, which are used in the control channel information of the 5G mobile communication standard. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Communications (cs.COMM) sub-categories. The proposed algorithm is based on exploiting the inherent structures of the frozen-bit locations in a polar-encoded block of data, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the Data Structures (cs.DS) and Signal Processing (cs.SI) sub-categories. Finally, the paper is tailored to the 5G standardization effort discussions, which suggests that it may also belong to the Computer Communications (cs.CC) sub-category.
